evidence: In the spatial domain, it appears as a soft, bell-shaped pattern - bright in the middle, fading smoothly outward.

triples.evidence: Despite the name, this filter is used to sharpen images. It works by subtracting a blurred version of the image from the original, which enhances the edges. In the spatial domain, you can see the filter kernel - dark around the edges, light in the center - designed to emphasize changes in intensity.

concepts.term: subtract a blurred version of the image from the original

evidence: This is an edge detection filter, which highlights regions of rapid intensity change.
In image processing, we often use specialized filters to enhance certain features or to suppress unwanted information.
Despite the name, this filter is used to sharpen images.
This is a smoothing filter, which reduces noise and small details.
This is an edge detection filter, which highlights regions of rapid intensity change.
MATLAB provides built-in functions for these filters, including fspecial for 2D and fspecial3 for 3D filtering, as well as options to design your own custom kernels.
